title: Passcode Protection in Android Devices Can be Bypassed.

profile.name: Nextcloud
profile.about: Access, share and protect your files, calendars, contacts, communication & more at home and in your enterprise.

vulnerability_information:
###What is The Vulnerability?

The Passcode can be bypassed by calling a MainLoginActivity which is com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity , We have successfully bypassed the passcode and are redirected to the App's User Interface.
of the user’s credentials:

Android Version: 9
Non Rooted Device.

##How to Reproduce:
1.) Setup a Emulated Device Via Android Studio AVD Using the Same Setup.
{F518191}

2.) Install NextCloud Client and Login Your NextCloud Account.

{F518192}

3.) Setup the PassCode

{F518193}

4.) Install Drozer and Drozer Agent

* https://labs.mwrinfosecurity.com/tools/drozer/

5.) Start the Drozer Embedded Server

{F518195}

6.) Open your CMD/Console and type ```drozer console connect```

█████████

7.) Close the NextCloud Client and Open it Again

{F518197}

8.) Go Back to Drozer Console and run this code
```run app.activity.start --component com.nextcloud.client com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity```

9.) Voila, Passcode Bypassed

{F518198}

##Supporting Materials

* Attached as poc.mp4

█████

## Impact

Successful exploitation of this vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass the android application's authentication mechanisms and gain unauthorized access to the user files and infos.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us!

Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster. For obvious reasons we'd like to ask you to not disclose this issue to any other party.

found a way, no need to use drozer all we need is adb,

adb shell am start -n com.nextcloud.client/com.owncloud.android.ui.activity.FileDisplayActivity

Which version do you tested?
There is a timeout you have to wait for, otherwise you can directly open the app (which is expected)

I am Using the Latest Version from the Google Play Store.

Version: 3.6.2
Last Updated: May 28 2019

█████████

Yes i am fully aware about the Timeout i have to wait for, and directly calling t he app shows no more pass codes.
however the fact that i was able to bypass it by just calling an activity.

I only tested it with latest 3.7.0 RC4, which is available via Google Play Beta program, as we will release it this week.
Can you give this a try?

can you send the apk here? 

Regards,

Angel\
and also, does this qualify to your bug bounty program?

> does this qualify to your bug bounty program?

Depends whether it works with the 3.7.0RC4 version. Of course we can not pay bounties for problems we fixed before that publicly already.
Okay, Please send the apk here

https://github.com/nextcloud/android/releases/tag/rc-3.7.0-04
gplay is with google play service
nextcloud is plain FOSS

Hello @nickvergessen,
I immediately Tested The App with 3.7.0RC4 Version, even with your latest build i can still bypass the passcode.
Apk Tested:
* gplay-release-30070054.apk


Here is a PoC Below.

████████

Please Let me know if you encountered any problems while reproducing the vulnerability.

Thanks!

Angel\
Any updates? just checking...

I re-checked. And for me with Android 9 Emulator it happens 1 out ~10 times that Passcode is not shown.
I'll have to investigate on this more…
I keep you updated

Update: 
I was wrong with 1 out of 10. 
For me it seems that this happens only one time after installing the app.
After that I cannot reproduce.
I am doing the same steps as you:
- start app 
- verify pin code is shown
- swipe app in recent apps to close
- trigger start with adb

Can you re-check if you can bypass pin after the first time?
Hello @tobiaskaminsky, i thought that its the timeout you're talking about, once you enter the passcode, it wont appear again.

I guess, we are mixing things: Timeout is set to 5s, so if you enter pin, close app and re-open app within 5s you do not have to enter pin.

But this should/must be Independent from very first start/set up.
So can you confirm that bypassing is not working after first time correct set up & using pin?
- install app
- set up pin protection
- close app
- wait 5s
- open app & enter pin
- close app
- swipe it from recent apps
- use adb to launch
- try it multiple times

If so, then it is indeed only a problem on very first installation/set up.
Okay, ill just boot to Kali and Check Things out.

Hey @tobiaskaminsky,

I Followed the steps you suggested and on my side, the bypassing is working after first time correct set up & using pin.

Here's The Proof of Concept:

██████
Let me know if the steps i've taken is correct.

Have you changed something to the default setting in emulator, like "don't keep activities"?
I am asking because if I open up NC app and start the Activity via adb, I do get something like "App already running, bringing to front".
For you it seems that always the app is freshly started.

I just try to find out why in your case you can bypass multiple times, but I cannot do so :/
The Emulator Doesnt Let me Alter the settings, i can only change the ram, storage size.
hello? any updates on this? its been a while

Hey,

can you test it with a real device? 
I tried it with several phones and I cannot reproduce any longer.
@tobiaskaminsky  i have succesfully reproduced the issue on my device (Samsung Galaxy S9)

The Device is Not Rooted/Jailbroken Thanks.

██████████

Hm.
I'll test it with other real devices, but fixing this needs some time as I first need to find a device where I can reproduce it.
I'll reply back later with an update.
hoping for this to get fixed soon ;)
hi @tobiaskaminsky  any updates?
Following Up, Any Updates on this?

I tried it now again with a Noia 6.1 and it does not happen there.
I know it is frustratring, but as I cannot reproduce it, I cannot fix it…
if you still cannot reproduce this, lets just close the report and after 45 days i will be disclosing this vulnerability.

If you still cannot reproduce this report on your End, i will disclose this issue anytime within this month.

Regards,

Angel.
I don't know where you are located, but maybe you can drop by our conference in Berlin (Germany) from 13th september until 20th september and bring your phone for a live debugging session.

Thanks a lot for your report. Much appreciated!

We're closing this issue for now as we fail to find reliable steps to reproduce the issue.
Im located in the Philippines and Its kinda far.
Hey, @nickvergessen Not Planning  to Disclosed this on Hackerone thanks!
Though, i will send the article here first before publishing
We would still like to disclose it, so we can link future reports to this one.
Could You just invite them here as duplicates? if that is okay? some personal details are involved in the PoC wouldnt want that to go Public Thanks.
I only found your name in one of the screenshots, did I miss something?
@nickvergessen In the Video, Some Personal Files are Exposed and Personal Emails and Passwords are can be seen.
Redacted all videos
Great!
Since Sensitive Informations has been redacted shall we?
